The term '''Jewish fundamentalism''' may refer to<ref>[http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/1192058/Jewish-fundamentalism Jewish fundamentalism (Encyclopædia Britannica)]</ref> [[militant (disambiguation)|militant]] religious [[Zionism]]<ref name="brit1">[http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/1191955/fundamentalism/252664/Jewish-fundamentalism-in-Israel#ref883280 Encyclopædia Britannica: Jewish fundamentalism in Israel]</ref> or [[Ashkenazi]] or [[Sephardi]] [[Haredi Judaism]].<ref name="brit1"/>
The term "[[fundamentalism]]" was originally used in reference to certain [[Christian]] groups but today commonly refers to the [[modernism|anti-modernist movements]] of any [[religion]] based on literal interpretation of religious scriptures.<ref>[http://www.sas.upenn.edu/penncip/lustick/lustick11.html For the Land and the Lord: Jewish Fundamentalism in Israel - I. Introduction: Definitions and Terminology: Fundamentalist vs. Ultra-Orthodox]</ref>
